interactions.flavorLineOne:
The Drifter rummages through a battered supply crate. He extracts a Machine Gun and tosses it toward you with a flourish.

"Don't say I never gave you nothin'," he winks.
Drifter's smile never falters as he accepts the delicious chocolate treats.
You haven't told the Drifter of your success, but he seems to already know. He tosses a reward your way.

"Give a man a mask, and you're givin' him permission to be a bad guy," Drifter says. "That's what you and your friends are all waiting for, right?"

He winks. "Have fun out there, huh? Tear it up."

"Give a man a mask, and you're givin' him permission to be a bad guy," Drifter says. "That's what you and your friends are all waiting for, right?"

He winks. "Have fun out there, huh? Tear it up. And, uh, have a little extra candy. Just a little 'thanks for not being a lousy snitch,' from me to you."

headerDisplayProperties.description: There are a lot of rumors circulating about your part in Uldren's demise. The Drifter wants to talk to you about them.
headerDisplayProperties.name: The Drifter

interactions.flavorLineOne: The Tower is buzzing with gossip about what actually went down at the top of the Watchtower. If you really did pull the trigger then you're the apple of the Drifter's eye and a perfect fit for his Gambit.

headerDisplayProperties.description: The Drifter has a unique perspective on death and Hunters. Touch base with him.
headerDisplayProperties.name: The Drifter

interactions.flavorLineOne: The Drifter encourages you to shake off your grief about Cayde. Somewhere, someone out there has a bullet with your name on it. So did Cayde. So does he. Nothing you can do but go out on your terms.

headerDisplayProperties.description: You've been working hard. Why not check in with the man behind all that hard work?
headerDisplayProperties.name: The Drifter

interactions.flavorLineOne: The Drifter sees something special in you. You're not like the other Guardians. You're fiercer, stronger, maybe even a little meaner and the Drifter's got his eye on you.

headerDisplayProperties.description: The Drifter wants to give you a little something in commemoration of your hard-fought victories.
headerDisplayProperties.name: The Drifter

interactions.flavorLineOne: The Drifter commends you for all your hard work. He warns that his old enemy, the Man with the Golden Gun, may come looking for you. You're not just guilty by association. You're guilty by action a new Dredgen.

The Drifter knows someone has been snooping into his affairs. He likes you, but he needs to trust you and so he has a simple question for you. Are you with him? Or are you against him?

Choose where your loyalties lie.
You choose to stand with the Drifter. Pleased by your decision, he rewards your loyalty with a request for assistance
You choose to stand with the Vanguard. The Drifter grudgingly respects your integrity, but this will change how he views you

There's gossip floating around the Tower that you might have snuck into a quarantined Cryptarch vault in the ruins of the old Tower.

Drifter is impressed. He asks you to keep him in mind if you ever go back.

Although Drifter is in the business of manufacturing new age Dredgens, he still can't help but be shocked when you show up to his shop carrying a replica Thorn. He wants nothing to do with it. If you're smart, neither should you.

"Well, well, well Another champion of the Light's come to play in the shadows."

The Drifter offers Gambit bounties, quests, shaders, and other rewards for challenges in the Gambit playlists.

Gambit combines cooperative and competitive gameplay. Teams of 4 compete to clear the battlefield of enemies. Hinder your opponents with enemy Blockers or Guardian Invaders. Summon and defeat a Primeval to win!

The Drifter tells you that he used to know the Emissary. She used to be a Guardian named Orin, with ties to the Awoken Queen. Then she left. She was changed.

Bristling, he demands that you back off. He believes there's nothing for you to learn from her.

The Drifter does not like that you continued your visits to the Emissary, but there's nothing he can do about it now and anyway, the two of you have bigger fish to fry. He's seen omens of the future, and he believes the only path to survival is the ethos bound up in Gambit and Gambit Prime.

You own both the Last Word and Thorn: two guns with larger-than-life reputations, two guns loaded with symbolism that Drifter fears you don't understand or worse, are deliberately ignoring. He warns you to be more cautious.

Drifter respects the way you've continued to make yourself notorious. You have no fear of declaring who and what you are. You've reckoned with yourself.

That kind of confidence can get you killed.

The Drifter is disturbed seeing the Last Word in your hand, but he is endlessly intrigued by the Hive weapon you uncovered. He offers a quick warning about trust, then brushes it all off with a laugh.

There is still much to learn about the Weapons of Sorrow. Hopefully, the trust you've placed in the Drifter will lead to new understandings.

"Welcome back, killer. Havin' fun? That's rhetorical. I know you are."

Return to the Drifter to acquire bounties, gear, and other rewards related to Gambit activities.

You've been at Gambit for a while now. You've met the enemies of Humanity head-on and made them pay. The Drifter has rewarded you handsomely for the Motes of Dark you've collected. Now it's time to see the culmination of your partnership with the Drifter.
"Hey, I see you. I know what you're about. Come to the Tower. A Guardian like you should get to know a fella like me. The benefits would be mutual." The Drifter
Drifter's eyes squint as he peers at you. He doesn't want you to be too comfortable.

"Well, well, well" Drifter says with a smirk. "I've known lots of folk who made the mistake of outstaying their welcome. Not many of 'em left today. But that's not your style, is it?"

"In and out in a flashclinical! You're a joy to watch, kid. Just do me a favor, all right? I'll admit I like havin' you around, so if you're plannin' to give me the slip someday, make sure to leave poor old Drifter a nice note." He gives a sly smile.

"Consider it repayment for this beauty. Happy trails, friend."

"You may be wondering what this was all for," the Drifter says.

"Sometimes, my friend, ignorance is bliss. Here's something for your trouble, but let's not ask too many questions, you dig?"

Drifter holds out a quiver and a Compound Bow with both of his greasy hands.

"Use this," he indicates the Bow, "To stick 'em with these." He juts his chin at the arrows. "Go to town."

As you approach, the Drifter fixes you with an appraising stare. Is he sizing you up?

In the next instant, he breaks into a disarming smile and you forget your doubt.

Drifter thanks you for your interest in his new "operations," saying that he hopes to see you out on the field very soon.

The Drifter has unveiled a new training exercise for the Guardians of the Tower: a role-based, single-round evolution of Gambit that he calls "Gambit Prime."

He's eager for you to give it a try.

The Drifter seems relieved that you're still willing to talk to him after you heard everything he had to say.

As far as Drifter is concerned, the two of you are part of a crew now. If anyone crosses either one of you (and they likely will, given Drifter's extensive list of enemies) well, he's got your back, and you've got his.

The Drifter remains as distant and standoffish as ever: He will not forget that you chose not to trust him.

You regret nothing.

Despite everything, though, you realize that he was right: He wasn't what you thought. He's something else: a fearful, scrabbling scavenger running from spectres of death. He's below your concern, but he may not yet be below your sense of duty.

The Drifter is jittery but earnest as he tells you that he's come to think of you as a friend. One of his only friends, at that.

To that end, the awkward tape he left you in the Derelict is the first in a series of tapes that are supposed to impart words of wisdom from "the ultimate prepper himself."

Begin your search in the European Dead Zone.

The Drifter has acquired an ancient Hive artifact that he thinks you should take a look at. He believes it might be tied to one of the Hive's fabled Weapons of Sorrow. He is eager to help you unlock its secrets and its power. He is offering you stolen pages from a dark Book to help further your understanding.

Restore the tainted artifact to its original state by defeating Hive and gathering items the Drifter needs.

The Drifter has set you on a dark path, but insists you are doing the right thing, regardless of the danger. After all, what better way to stand against Darkness than to embrace it?

The cleansed artifact hungers for Light. Defeat your fellow Guardians to feed it.
You found a component part of some kind of weapon at Callum's grave. It must be what he stole from the Drifter. He'd probably like it back.

headerDisplayProperties.description: You gathered all you needed for a ritual of your own.
headerDisplayProperties.name: The Draw

interactions.flavorLineOne:
The Drifter has helped you track a dangerous Hive warrior tied to the infamous Weapons of Sorrow. The fight won't be easy. You will be outgunned and alone, but you've come this far and there's no turning back.

It's high noon, Guardian. Gun down the Hive weapons expert before his diseased arsenal can spread.

The Drifter is pleased with your performance in Gambit Prime, but that's not the only con he's cooked up.

With some sleight of hand and an unnecessary flourish, he presents you with a curious device that he calls a Synthesizer.

Your new Synthesizer can be used to combine Synths found in Gambit Prime into Motes which can be used in another one of Drifter's schemes: a mysterious trial he mentions briefly as the Reckoning.
You've defeated a particularly powerful Primeval in Gambit and taken its heart. Drifter might find it valuable. Take it to him.

Drifter bristles defensively when your Ghost mentions that you experienced a vision from the Emissary of the Nine. He, too, is experiencing visions, and he wants you to keep your distance.

Whether you respect his wishes is, of course, entirely up to you.

"Now that you got a little taste of the action, how about we up the ante? I've got bounties worth yer time, kid."

Gambit bounties offer focused objectives for Guardians to complete while playing Gambit activities.

Select Gambit bounties from the Drifter. Complete their objectives. Then, claim the completed bounties to gain XP and rewards.

The ritual you disrupted on Titan intrigues the Drifter. He believes that a certain Hive Wizard was behind the twisted ceremony. She was betrothed to a Hive weapon master, and the two were responsible for the creation of new Weapons of Sorrow.

It's time for a ritual of your own.

"Really pisses me off when people break their word," Drifter says. "The Man with the Golden Gun was set to leave this system to meresume his hunt for the Shadows of Yor beyond the borders of Vanguard authority. But he's back, without prompting. And he's killed associates of mineassociates like you. Lightbearers.

"Might be the Vanguard's decided I've outlived my welcomebrought the Man back in to cut ties, and they're startin' with my rank and file. Might be he's waitin' to burn us down last. Or could be he's workin' with that Praxic rat Aunor. Everywhere she goes, something dies in a fire." A pause. "You know what? I don't care what's going on down there. I need you to make a statement. Get into the Crucible and sow some discord. I'll pay you for every Guardian you drop. No, really. Let me hear 'em scream."

"That look in yer eye says you're ready for some Gambit Prime, my friend.

"Fair warning Prime ain't for the faint of heart. But that's what makes it so gosh-darn fun."

Head into Gambit Prime from the Gambit tab of the Director.

Drifter takes a look at your trusty Synthesizer, scratches his jaw, gives you a long look of consideration then smiles. "Figure that thing's due for an upgrade, don't you think? You scratch my back, I'll scratch yours. And then some. Ha!"

The Drifter is offering a bounty that you can use to upgrade your Synthesizer to the next level. Take a look at the Drifter's bounties to get started.
The Drifter slips you a package on the sly, giving you a nod of acknowledgment. He's grateful that you have his back.

headerDisplayProperties.description: Acquire a Gambit Prime bounty from the Drifter.
headerDisplayProperties.name: Gambit, in Its Prime

interactions.flavorLineOne:
The Drifter has unveiled a new training exercise for the Guardians of the Tower: a role-based, single-round evolution of Gambit that he calls "Gambit Prime."

He's eager for you to give it a try.

failureStrings: Reset Your Infamy Rank Three Times
Source: Complete the "Season 8: Keepin' On" quest.
Requires completion of the "Green with Envy" pursuit.
Requires completion of the "Free Advertising" quest.
Can hold only one at a time
